result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas D Binns was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

miscConds.notes:
BOTH COUNT: -Pay supervision fees. 
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharge during period of probation, any cash bail to apply. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment subject to tax intercept and any applicable collection procedures.
-Restitution set at ZERO.
-Obtain/maintain full time employment/schooling or combination of both.

-No contact with firearms.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-Stay current with Child Support Payments. 
-As to Case Number 04PA2755, defendant to pay $5000.00 towards arrears, interests, and fees, during the period of probation in this case.
-Provide DNA Sample.

-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens. No controlled substance without a valid prescription.

timeConds.notes: Concurrent with: -AS TO EACH COUNT: Concurrent with each other. Court will allow Huber Release as determined by the HOC. *Defendant to report by 9/12/2019 by 5:00 p.m.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicholas D Binns in court with attorney Thomas j Kasen.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: The court sentenced the defendant to 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 24 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 2: The court sentenced the defendant to 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 24 MONTHS.


CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-AS TO EACH COUNT: concurrent to each other: Serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction as Condition Time. Court will allow Huber Release as determined by the HOC. Defendant to report by 9/12/2019 by 5:00 p.m. 
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens. No controlled substance without a valid prescription. 
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-Obtain/maintain full time employment/schooling or combination of both.
-Stay current with Child Support Payments. 
-As to Case Number 04PA2755, defendant to pay $5000.00 towards arrears, interests, and fees, during the period of probation in this case. 
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay supervision fees. 
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharge during period of probation, any cash bail to apply. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment subject to tax intercept and any applicable collection procedures.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at ZERO.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed, Motion to Withdraw as counsel

Defense counsel contacted the Court and requested a hearing to address Defendant's request for new counsel. 
Hearing scheduled January 16, 2019 at 2:30pm before Judge Davis, Branch 21.

Defendant Nicholas D Binns in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Edward O'Brien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State advised that Defendant has picked up new charges.  State moved to REVOKE the DPA.  Defense and Defendant CONCEDED that there is a FACTUAL basis for the REVOCATION.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Sentencing.  All parties are advised effective January 7, 2019 case will be reassigned to Honorable Judge Cynthia Davis, Branch 21, in Room 113 of the Safety Building.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 23, 2019 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas D Binns in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Ediwn O'Brien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Prior to matter being called on the Record, case was Staffed in Chambers.  Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for December 10, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nicholas D Binns in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin for Barbara K Due.  Brad Alan Vorpahl for Angela Cunningham appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State advised that due to new charges the agreement will be EXTENDED for a period of NINETY (90) DAYS.  Defendant to continue paying on the agreed-upon schedule.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for October 22, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nicholas D Binns in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Gilbert F Urfer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State advised that Defendant is in compliance with the spirit of the agreement.  Defendant has a small amount of support to pay before the matter can be disposed.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for July 24, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

State advised that Defendant is in full compliance and should be COMMENDED.  Court COMMENDED Defendant for his compliance with the payments.  State moved to ADJOURN until mid-year.  Defense did NOT object.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for July 11, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nicholas D Binns in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm 


 AS TO COUNT 1 
The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement.  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Br. 33, Judge Ashley for Review

AS TO COUNT 2
The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement.  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Br. 33, Judge Ashley for Review


AS TO COUNT 3
Pursuant to negotiations and On the Motion of the State, COUNT 3 is DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing

AS TO COUNT 4
Pursuant to negotiations and the Motion of the State, COUNT 4 is DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing

Defendant Nicholas D Binns not in court.  Christopher J. Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
